aboutCourse:
Our School Direct training programme lasts for one academic year, starting in September 2020. During the training year, time is split between school based placements where you are immersed in school life to develop your teaching experience and structured taught sessions that focus on key educational theory and practice and develop your subject knowledge across the primary curriculum.

As a School Direct Trainee with Victoria Academies Trust, you will attend taught sessions at Birmingham University with a few additional twilight sessions taught by our own team of highly skilled, practising teachers. These additional sessions are based on pupil independence and our challenge based curriculum. They will be held within one of the Trust schools and often provide the opportunity to observe teaching in practice, in order to facilitate simulating and highly relevant training experiences and make immediate links between theory and practice.

The teaching commitment is built up over the training year during school placements, where you will be immersed in school life and supported by school-based practitioners who are experienced and skilled teachers within our schools.

Trainees are assessed via evidence gathered during the teaching experiences, school-based tasks and formal assignments linked to key areas of teaching and learning.

Successful completion of the course will result in QTS and PGDipEd.
interviewProcess:
We work in partnership with our accredited provider, the University of Birmingham, to co-ordinate the recruitment process. Where possible, interviews will be held at either Victoria Park Primary Academy or at one of the schools within Victoria Academies Trust. Please note as a result of current restrictions due to Covid-19, interviews are presently being held remotely. 

The interview process involves a combination of tasks including:

•	reading an educational article and discussing key themes at interview
•	planning a short reading activity and discussing how you would deliver this in person
•	a formal interview with Senior Leaders from across the Trust
•	and a student panel interview

The rigorous selection process is designed to help us decide if you are suitable to train to teach and for you to assess whether teaching is the right career path for you.
howSchoolPlacementsWork:
School-based experiences are a central part of the programme. During your training year, you will  carry out two placements within the nine schools that form Victoria Academies Trust ensuring you gain experience in both key stage 1 and 2 and enabling you to teach within the 5-11 year-old age range.  Although all schools within Victoria Academies Trust have shared values, ethos and approach, you will find the schools very diverse, offering you a range of training experiences and preparing you well for life after training. 

Just some of the diverse differences across the schools within the Trust include; pupils with English as an additional language, schools with a social enterprise, a school with an autism base, schools with nurseries and without, small one-form entry schools to larger three-form entry schools.

We have a range of schools across the Midlands to suit the candidate's location where possible:

•	Devonshire Infant Academy (Smethwick)
•	Devonshire Junior Academy (Smethwick)
•	Northfield Manor Primary Academy (Northfield)

•	Birchen Coppice Primary Academy (Kidderminster)

personalQualities:
We are looking for applicants who can demonstrate their:

•	Motivation and genuine passion for teaching and working with children 
•	Resilience and a strong commitment to the teaching profession and continued-self development 
•	Creativity in order to enable pupils to develop into confident, enthusiastic and effective learners.
•	Excellent communication skills and strong subject knowledge

We want to offer places to trainees who align to our values which are: Loyalty – by putting family first
Tenacity – by insisting on excellence
Kindness – by doing good as you go
Courage – by embracing innovation
Brilliance – by seizing Success.
otherRequirements:
Before commencing the programme successful candidates will need to:

complete an enhanced Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check.
complete relevant checks to ensure they have the health and physical capacity to teach.
agree to abide by the University of Birmingham Code of Professional Conduct and Fitness to Practise.
